metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17233 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A SIGFPE signal is raised in the function H5D__create_chunk_file_map_hyper() of H5Dchunk.c in the HDF HDF5 through 1.10.3 library during an attempted parse of a crafted HDF file, because of incorrect protection against division by zero. It could allow a remote denial of service attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1
hdf5-tools - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1
libhdf5-103 - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1
libhdf5-cpp-103 - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1
libhdf5-java - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1
libhdf5-jni - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1
libhdf5-mpich-103 - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1
libhdf5-openmpi-103 - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1').
